Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; two added white bands near top of sherd; exterior: at top, handle frill and to its right maeander pattern; below, paired hook maeander frieze between bands and lines; below, rays.
Curator's comments: The decorative patterns are remarkably similar to those on the Würzburg chalices. Although Lemos does not compare this specific sherd with the Würzburg chalices, based on the similar compositions it can be placed with the others listed as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 234, no. 135)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0193) (phase 2)
